Topic.Title: Latest Barrons (out today) calls Amazon a mysterious "Black Box"

Message.Msg: what's amazing to me, even having seen such outright periods of nonstep speculation going back to the late 1980's, is that no analyst, none, asks AMZN or hold their feet to the fire, of providing detail of their sales breakdowns. Yet, they can keep rasing price targets without them as long as the stock goes up. This is how WS works and AMZN is in the sweetspot like no Company I've ever seen , with such a "Black Box". Doesn't say much for the underlying foundation of the US economy, and more illustrates how big of a Ponzi Scheme the economy is becoming: having the Fed base the economy's health on the basis of providing a "Wealth Effect" to drrive economic behavior, regardless of the values it hinges upon. Interesting times indeed.

Topic.Title: we have instruments of torture and we will use them

Message.Msg: Just wait. Amazon is going to get it from all sides next year. MSFT had its turn, then GOOG. AMZN actually deserves it. It is effectively tying via its near monopoly on e-books, requiring DRM to lock folks into its ecosystem. It is definitely treading on dangerous ground with its MFN pricing requirement for 3P. Add the abuse of payment terms to small players and the now clear anti-competitive predatory pricing exhibited with Quidsi (where Amazon showed its true modus operandi -- use the threat of losing money to put others out of business -- and the next time AMZN raises prices on 3P/FBA, expect domestic lawsuits to start flying...

Message.Title: SCAMAZON MORE TROUBLES:Amazon's third-party deals must change, German watchdog says: paper
Message.Msg: Amazon's third-party deals must change, German watchdog says: paper ReutersReuters – 7 hours ago FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Germany's antitrust watchdog accused Amazon of undermining competition when dealing with third-party merchants and said it would impose reform unless the Internet retailer changed its rules, a German newspaper reported. "Luckily, we have instruments of torture, which we will use if necessary," Andreas Mundt, the president of the German cartel office, was quoted as telling daily Sueddeutsche Zeitung. A struggle with competition authorities in its second-largest market after the United States would add to Amazon's woes. Its German operations have been rattled by a dispute over employees' pay and a trade union has warned that staff could strike during the Christmas holiday season. "The terms of Amazon's Marketplace in effect obstruct competition," Mundt said, according to a pre-release on Sunday of the newspaper's Monday edition. "We are in talks with Amazon to eliminate these impediments to competition...If necessary, we will issue a crystal clear decree." Separately, Amazon has been criticized over its tax payments and leading policy makers have called for a new German government to crack down on tax avoidance by multinational firms without waiting for its European partners to act. At the heart of the watchdog's complaints about Amazon's Marketplace is a requirement that third-party merchants must offer their cheapest price when selling their products over the platform. Amazon was not immediately available for comment.

Topic.Title: prediction

Message.Msg: People who had huge profits on GOOG's $1000 spike will move onto AMZN for the similar earnings play. Since AMZN will report on Thursday close, I expect AMZN will move up $20 each day on Monday, Tuesday and Wesdesday. That will move AMZN to $389 or $400 a share. On Thursday it will be flat or slightly down because of profits taking. Then earnings will decide Friday's price. It will be $450 if AMZN beats or get back to $300 if AMZN misses. Either way, it is very safe to buy AMZN till Wednesday because GOOG longs have deep pocket and AMZN is their first target to grow their profits even more.
